item.title: A thanks to the traits working group in 2021
item.description: So…this is awkward. I wanted to write this post near the end of 2021 or beginning of 2022, but time got away from me, as it does so often. However, a half-completed draft has been open in my browser this entire time, and I think it’d be a shame for it to go to waste and not celebrate all the work done on traits working-group related things and to celebrate the people who have done that amazing work. Given that this is “unofficial” though, I’ll be a little less formal than I otherwise would if this was posted to the Inside Rust Blog.

item.title: I built a receipt printer for GitHub issues

item.title: Ridiculously easy to use Tunnels
item.description: Today, we’re thrilled to announce that we have launched a new solution to remotely create, deploy, and manage Tunnels and their configuration directly from the Zero Trust dashboard. This new solution allows our customers to provide their workforce with Zero Trust network access in 15 minutes or less
item.author: (Abe Carryl)

item.title: ImageSharp 2.0.0: The Feature-Packed Release
item.description: ImageSharp, one of the most popular .NET image-processing libraries, released version 2 of their library. The release includes major features such as supporting WebP, TIFF and PBM as well adding XMP support with various performance improvements and enhancements for JPEG and PNG formats. This release drops support for .NET Standard 1.3. The update replaces version 1.0.4.
item.author:
(Mohamad Lawand
Technical Architect Follow)

item.title: Just because you stopped waiting for it, doesn't mean the Task stopped running
item.description: In this post I look at what happens to Tasks that are 'cancelled' using the new .NET 6 WaitAsync() API, and in other Task cancellation scenarios

item.title: The Cube Rule
item.description: Identify your food based on the location of structural starch. Is a hot dog a sandwich? No, it's clearly a taco.
